duties_responsibilities.duty: Lead the design, evolution, and maintenance of the wireless network at a prestigious research university.
Engage and manage vendors, possess expert knowledge in wireless subject matter and design, provide leadership and mentorship to team members.
Coordinate with University Construction Coordinators on multimillion-dollar building projects, provide guidance and plans for wireless life cycle and improvement.
Engage with customers to find solutions for their demands, aid in the maintenance, support, and design of the entire university network.
Possess a comprehensive understanding of networking technologies and the ability to provide guidance on how changes to network topology and equipment can affect the wireless design.
Have a deep understanding of 802.11 technology and the highest level of experience in designing interior wireless in a variety of spaces.

Effectively mentor and task personnel to accomplish wireless projects across the university, engage with other higher education institutions as a technical leader through participation in leadership activities within EDUCAUSE.
Work closely with the ITS Infrastructure & Operations (I&O) unit to support and maintain the infrastructure for network, data communications transport services, and campus desktop computers.

education_certification.credential: Masters’ and 2-4 years’ experience; or Bachelors and 3-5 years’ experience; or a combination of related education and experience in substitution.
